title: Matchsafe, late 19th–early 20th century
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Form is a rectangle with pointed top and cut bottom corners.  The front has a linear border with long paisley framing plain center with four quadrant crest.   A Rampant lion on two light quadrants.  Castle tower on two dark quadrants.  The back also has a linear border with long paisley framing scene of winged nymph kneeling on rock gazing at her reflection in water. Image of 'white rock girl'.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, late 19th–early 20th century.
late 19th–early 20th century. Sterling silver, enamel. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-373.
